name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by wharfrat, DiamondMonster, Semiquaver, atticusonline, ravindra108, prowle4763, DerSquirrel, pogo, SotiCoto)

name: arthurdentlives
text:
5 chubbies
0 lames

0 lames????

name: soticoto
text: 36 chubbies and 8 lames.

name: dersquirrel
text:
36 chubbies and 9 lames.

It's Asherdan. You're just obligated to.

name: soticoto
text:
Well, I used to think that way, and then I got to really know the content of Asherdan's posts and realised that he is actually less annoying or objectionable than around 90% of the other folk across this assetbar. So I started chubbing him instead.

Incidentally, the fact that you can still lame things clarifies something in my mind. I believe I will have to start over with a new account next time I archive-trawl... mostly on account NOT of the inability to lame, but the inability to vote on strips. Very annoying.

name: dersquirrel
text: Asherdan's usually right.  You read what he says, nod your head in agreement, then lame him.  It's an Achewood AssetBar comment section tradition.  It's a thing.

name: soticoto
text:
I exist to break such things.
The very fact that it was a tradition, and thus had become part of the metagame, made me realise that I had to break free from it.
If most folks do it and can't provide a good reason why they do it... chances are it is part of the metagame, and for the sake of retaining individuality, should be avoided.

name: dumase
text: WHAT IS GOING ON MAN. YOU ARE FINALLY ACCEPTED?!?!

name: semiquaver
text: A comment left by semiquaver was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Daemon, riotdejaneiro, StoatLad, waddlerz, Satyr)

name: xaxx
text: Methinks the people who lamed this have issues.

name: 1000hz
text: Does onstad screenprint all the shirts himself too? That would be pretty sweet.

name: riazm
text: I think the screenprinting apparatus is for the posters, but I don't think he does the shirts. I could be wrong.

name: juancarlos
text: hell of tight screen printing, my prints always looked like crap, paint overflowing through the unblocked parts of the screen.

name: the_voice
text: All too thick in one part and too thin in another. All emulsion getting ruined because there is light coming in  under the bathroom door.

name: direhaggis
text: My attempts look like a gang of dudes with hayfever did a bukake scene in primary colors.

name: salvagebar
text: Chubbied for sheer descriptive power.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: seconded

name: philophobe
text:
Anyone know what it's like to be vomiting and smiling at the same time?

I wish I didn't.

name: saint
text: holy shit it worked

name: headphones
text: I would wear that on a shirt

name: lateadopter
text: I recall a mention somewhere (one of the blogs, the apparel shop, somewhere) of Cafe Press.  At least at one point in time, he was using them.

name: 1000hz
text:
They definitely aren't still CafePressed.

They have been screenprinted since at least 2004.

name: alzuna
text: In the high school graphics class I took we used this way to print on shirts. It takes forever, the ink almost always goes in the wrong part even if you covered everything up thoroughly with duct tape and everything, and you ALWAYS messed up your first try and would have to buy another shirt.

name: alzuna
text: So, the point of what I was saying is you can use it that way (as far as I knew from that one class) but mass producing shirts with it would be madness.

name: hypoluxa
text: Hey!!!! I have a set of those glasses in the bottom right panel.

name: hypoluxa
text: That glass, rather.

name: blarghamagarky
text:
I love knowing that I use the same processes to screen print as onstad (also we use the same packing tape)


(I have little joy in my life)

(damn)

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Ray: Damn fine Christmas news!
Onstad: What I got for Christmas

WHOO TWO YEARS OF BLOGS SNATCHMONKEYS

name: dapooka
text:
Who are you calling a...

Nevermind. Comment acknowledged and accepted as truth. Another chubby for your efforts.

name: pogo
text: Nobody snatches MY monkey!

name: mangtastic
text: I don't think that is what is meant by "snatchmonkey".  At least not in my perverted mind.

name: xiaomimi
text: I will gladly give out prizes to whoever comes up with the best True Meaning of the phrase "snatchmonkey."

name: mangtastic
text: Snatchmonkey, n.  A small primate that inhabits a snatch.

name: woodenteeth
text: Snatchmonkey, n. A small kleptomaniacal primate often given to scurrying up the skirts of the native women in the jungled areas of Tophropan who are renowned for their elaborate vaginal ornamentation.

name: goatmasterflash
text:
Snatchmonkey - unplanned baby resulting from a night of drunken jungle loving.

Fuck-trophy: baby resulting from an intentional, planned pregnancy.

name: salvagebar
text: Outstanding definitions; too bad these are down at the bottom of the thread. They haven't gotten enough love.

name: pogo
text: This is no thread, at 26 posts.  You should see some on the 800-class threads.

name: spicyponyhead
text: I call all babies "fuck-trophies". Or crotch droppings. Or rug monkeys. So why NOT call babies "snatchmonkey"? Brilliant.

name: spinynorman
text: Snatchmonkey is a fella I know, hangs out down by the newspaper hutch and the Cho Wun deli, standing underneath the faded green awning trying to sell secondhand cell phones and chewing gum to anyone that walks by. He holes up down the alley in a cardboard shanty with Gyppo Fran (I know she ain't no gypsy, she's an Akron girl really) and they can whistle a tune that'll echo around in the empty parts of you and make the morning a little sweeter, but only a little.

name: tekende
text: I think I would actually be interested in reading the book Ray talks about in this entry. If only it were real.
